sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Stalking No Contact Order Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Stalking No Contact Order Act.

sections.heading: Purpose. Stalking generally refers to a course of conduct, not a single act
sections.text: Stalking behavior includes following a person, conducting surveillance of the person, appearing at the person's home, work or school, making unwanted phone calls, sending unwanted emails, unwanted messages via social media

sections.heading: Trial by jury. There shall be no right to trial by jury in any proceeding to obtain, modify, vacate or extend any stalking no contact order under this Act
sections.text: However, nothing in this Section shall deny any existing right to trial by jury in a criminal proceeding.

sections.heading: Subject matter jurisdiction. Each of the circuit courts has the power to issue stalking no contact orders.
sections.text: Subject matter jurisdiction. Each of the circuit courts has the power to issue stalking no contact orders.

sections.heading: Jurisdiction over persons.  The courts of this State have jurisdiction to bind (1) State residents and (2) non-residents having minimum contacts with this State, to the extent permitted by the long-arm statute, Section 2-209 of the Code of Civil Procedure

sections.heading: Venue. A petition for a stalking no contact order may be filed in any county where (1) the petitioner resides, (2) the respondent resides, or (3) one or more acts of the alleged stalking occurred

sections.heading: Mutual stalking no contact orders are prohibited
sections.text: Correlative separate orders undermine the purposes of this Act. If separate orders are sought, both must comply with all provisions of this Act.

sections.heading: Accountability for actions of others
sections.text: For the purposes of issuing a stalking no contact order, deciding what remedies should be included and enforcing the order, Article 5 of the Criminal Code of 2012 shall govern whether respondent is legally accountable for the conduct of another person.

sections.heading: Violation. An initial knowing violation of a stalking no contact order is a Class A misdemeanor
sections.text: A second or subsequent knowing violation is a Class 4 felony.
